website_summaries.verdict: The Harmony 700 is a fine remote, but Logitech's older universal remotes outclass it in features and value.
pros: Works well as a universal remote
cons: Better Harmony remotes can be purchased for the same price

customer_reviews.title: Some utility but like a troubled child everything seems like a struggle.
customer_reviews.text: ] ] I wanted to love this and it was almost there with a good manual useful features. here are the issues I had: 1. Difficulty setting up.. Never could get it to recognize tivo so really i am using the tivo universal remote which does everything i want for less dollars. sigh 2. Difficulty charging. There seems to be some usb the charger does not like. Other reviewers have had similar issues. 3. The ergonomics and intuitive nature of the design could be better. I don't think i will buy another logitech remote. To be fair, i am not sure there are any exceptional ones out there if this was one of the highest rated.
customer_reviews.author: BuzzlitebeerTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Did not control devices as programmed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to help my elderly parents be able to control their entertainment devices. they're getting up there in age and needed some assistance turning on and off the different components base on what they were watching. I thought this could be a good remote for them. It was not. it wouldn't switch from watching TV to watch a DVD appropriately. When powering off the system from watching TV and then go back in to watch DVD and it wouldn't turn on the correct components. the help guide on the remote wasn't helpful for them. I returned this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Amazing remote! Super easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: This remote is amazing! I wish I would have bought one sooner. We have been using 4 different remotes (smart tv remote, soundbar, satellite and DVD/DVR player). This remote controls them all with ease. The little screen gives you extra commands you wouldn't find normally on a remote that didn't come with the device. You don't have to go back to the original remotes to changes settings, etc. Highly recommend this remote! Also super easy setup, all you have to do it download the harmony program, plug the remote in and follow the directions on screen. No searching for device codes
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Smith

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Incredible!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I have a drawer of so called useless "universal remotes"!! It wasn't until I received this Logitech Harmony 700 that I found an truly outstanding remote! And armed with your model number, programming this remote is so so easy!! I love it!!! But be aware that it will not program an Amazon Firestrick. One issue is that the OK button and the 4 arrow keys around it are a bit small. I'm diabetic and my finger tips are numb so pressing these small buttons so close together is a problem occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This was the first of two Logitech remotes I've bought. It was dead on arrival. I bought another one, which lasted a little over a year. Considering how much these cost, their quality is awful. I just bought a DirecTV remote for $5 that is supposed to have the same programming capability this one has. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: the tool man

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Only my second programmable universal remote and I really like it. I bought my first programmable universal remote many years ago. The easy and flexibility of configuring the remote on the computer makes setup way easier than my previous remote. I really like the way that it automatically lights up when it is moved. You don't need to think about where the light button is located, since there isn't one. We have only been using the remote a few hours each day, but the battery life has never been an issue yet. I plug it in overnight every few weeks. I will likely buy another one of these remotes for use in another room.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great spare remote with a logical button layout
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a spare for my Harmony One. Every since Logitech went to the newer models, I have not been happy, and chose instead to buy this. Although it's a step down from the touch sensitive One, it offers the same control layout with the exception of the top buttons to start particular activities (Watch TV, Watch a Movie, Listen to Music, etc.) The lettering on those buttons is a little small for some in the house. I am glad I found this unit to control everything while I sent the One off for repairs. I'm glad Logitech still offers a unit with a rational control layout!
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Remotes
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Logitech remote. I have one for every entertainment system in my place. They are so versatile. You can customize nearly EVERYTHING! Make the displays and functions the way YOU want them!
customer_reviews.author: Jailer 58

customer_reviews.title: Some of kind of defect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of this model that we have had. I like the Harmony family because of the ease of programming and replacing remotes. Our first one lasted almost three years, then it started to reset itself in the middle of operation, going back to the home screen and thinking that everything is off. After three years, I figured it was time to replace it anyway. Then this one, after less than 4 months of use, started to have the exact same problem. So I think that it's some kind of common mechanical or electronic problem inherent in the manufacture of the model. Not going to get this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Calimota

customer_reviews.title: A Good Replacement for the Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Harmony One, which was getting worn out and some buttons quit working. Unfortunately the Harmony One is no longer available. The Harmony 700 is almost and good. It appears to be more rugged, but does not have the recharge "saddle" that the Harmony One had. It has to be plugged in to recharge. Otherwise it does everything that the Harmony One did and it was easy to transfer the settings from the Harmony One to the Harmony 700.
customer_reviews.author: JimBo

customer_reviews.title: Battery’s last short time and hard to charge
customer_reviews.text: Battery doesn’t last very long. Batteries get very hot and multiple times when I try to charge it says to insert battery’s, that’s very worrisome, take them in and out a few times and it charges. Not very happy with this model at all. Waiting for it to crap out. Wish they’d kept the 650. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: I received this remote on 12/22/2016. Have been using ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this remote on 12/22/2016. Have been using for about 6 weeks. I noticed that while charging the batteries, the bottom of the remote becomes very hot. The battery icon never showed fully charged no matter how long I charge it for. A support post by Logitech said to charge it for a minimum of 3 hours. It now gives me an error message that says batteries can not be charged. I have removed the batteries several times with no successful result. It also gives me error messages that say replace batteries. I have contacted the manufacturer and am waiting for instructions. I will update when they respond.
customer_reviews.author: S Vau

customer_reviews.title: Bring It All Together
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Logitech once again. I have an elaborate home entertainment setup with a tivo, separate amp and windows media center. It took me forever to program things just the way I wanted them on my old Logitech remote. I used there online programming feature to save my settings once I had everything perfect. I had been using my old remote for years with no problems them my wife somehow cracked it. Some buttons lost function so I replaced it with this new remote. The best part was my settings that were saved went right into this unit and I didn't skip a beat. One huge reprogramming headache avoided!!!!
customer_reviews.author: 1HonestMan

customer_reviews.title: I like it better than the more expensive version with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. Carries a charge for a long time. I like it better than the more expensive version with the fancy touch screen we had before--always found the touch screen to hard to use due to small size and the odd viewing angle you have when you're trying to see what you're pressing on the touch screen while aiming the remote at the TV. I find physical buttons next to the display are a more reliable and easier way to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Space Potato

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this two years ago ???
customer_reviews.text: We finally put and end to the salad bowl of remotes. Controls our TV, sound bar, dvr, Sony 2 zone receiver, blu-ray, AppleTV, and I know I'm missing one more. So easy to program and everyone in the family can figure it out. Occasional snag if you're not pointing it at the components, but easily you can select the individual device and turn it on. Just buy it. Also, I like this one compared to the next model up because it has actual number buttons. So if that's important to you don't worry about this not being powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: update
customer_reviews.text: It does not "learn" buttons on my directv remote making it a pain cause I'm use to easy 1 step buttons.Syncing this on My Harmony is also a pain cause it takes me plugging it into the computer over and over till it finally works. It doesn't turn on all my devices like it should so I'm always having to turn everything off then back on but that doesn't even work most of the time. Looking for a better universal remote. Update: Their customer service is very good. They updated my software with delete buttons that were missing to run my directv remote. I'm satisfied now.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent remote for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent remote for the price. I have a harmony one remote but that is significantly more. The only thing this doesn't have is a docking station. However the rechargeable battery seems to last a long time. I just plug it back in in the evening. The Harmony one has a dock that you place it in. Other then that both remotes control everything just fine. I have a surround sound receive, uverse box, roku, DVD player and this has not problem controlling them all. The only improvement they could make would be to make a docking cradle like the Harmony one.
customer_reviews.author: AmaniSofia

customer_reviews.title: It is terrific, set-up was easy
customer_reviews.text: I got the Harmony 700 to replace a Harmony 880 that died. I wish I had gotten the 700 first and saved a bunch of money. I needed the 700 since it can control six devices, while the 650 only handles five. It is terrific, set-up was easy, it works perfectly, and is very comfortable in the hand. I like the fact that I can use regular batteries should the included rechargeable ones lose their power since it takes several hours to re-charge. The only fault I can see is that there is no indication of remaining battery life. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: InspectorT

customer_reviews.title: ONE Remote to RULE them ALL
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Controlling a Vizio TV, Apple TV (2nd Gen), a Roku, a Bose Speaker system and a FiOS set top box. One remote to RULE them ALL!! Programming the devices in the software is very straight forward with the application you download from the Logitech website. I used my MAC to program them via a Wizard type interface. Then you use the included USB cable to synchronize the new configuration to the remote. Very simple. The unit uses AA rechargeable batteries and the charge seems to last pretty long. I charge it about once a week and have not had any issues. You can always use AA batteries in a pinch if needed.
customer_reviews.author: RGMarti

customer_reviews.title: SO glad this was still available
customer_reviews.text: SO glad this was still available. This remote works well with our sat dish, dvd, blu-ray, tuner, all the electronics, except the Playstation, Logitech has an optional device to add for Playstation control with this 700 remote. Logged into the harmony software, Plugged remote into the computer, and uploaded my previous setup and worked right out of the box. Too bad this unit is discontinued, very reasonably priced. Also like the ability to use rechargeable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Friendlyviper

customer_reviews.title: Last of a dying breed.  Reasonably priced, still easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replace an earlier Harmony 720? remote. Very similar. Easy to program sequences once you understand the concept. Took a little tweaking to get them right but once done, it's set it and forget it. Being able to setup Favorite channels is a great feature. Use it every day. Remote is as responsive as the original equipment remotes. Battery lasts for weeks between recharges. Works with the latest gear including Apple TV. Logitech regularly updates the software, firmware and device database so this should be viable for years. Unit is compact and not intimidating to users that are used to a stock remotes but also provides power and flexibility if you are a tech geek.
customer_reviews.author: Commodore B.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomend
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. Just wish my dog would stop chewing it up so I wouldn't have to keep buying them. Batteries go a long time in between charges. charged it when I got it and have only had to charge it once since, have had about 2 months. Easy to set up and program. I did have a Harmony One (before the dog got a hold of it) so I had all the software on the computer and went through all the hard stuff already. Very easy to replace A Harmony remote compared to starting fresh. Great remote, great price. Buy, buy, buy.
customer_reviews.author: akh105

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Like every other family in the country we had 4 or 5 remotes in our living room. Which was driving me nuts. I was hesitant to buy this remote because of the reviews making it seem like one had to be a rocket scientist to set t up. So, when we did get the remote we set aside an hour to get it all right. It only took 20 minutes and a double of tips off google searches to set up. Since then, we are a one remote living room. The charge lasts more than a month at a time, which is great. Not a cheap remote, but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this remote. It's function is 5 star; I don;t think there are many competitors with Logitech on this. It's also gets 5 stars in feel. The weight, shape, and button texture are just right. I keep hanging on to it after I'm done using it. Anyone familiar with the Harmony remotes know that the the programming interface is as easy as anything I've used and is pretty powerful in what it offers for preset macros and control for individual products and brands. I've yet to find a device it wasn't ready for. I currently use it to control Directv, LG smart TV, XBox, Xbox/Spherex Strereo, Vizio TV, and a Sony Blu Ray/Net Device.
customer_reviews.author: N. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Besides that it programs better than my older remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Logitech remote, I bought a new tv and a sound bar with a remote sub. I could not get my old remote to program default settings. I ordered the new one to resolve this issue, but I seem to be in the same boat. I'm hoping to find time to work on this. Besides that it programs better than my older remote. On a positive note it did arrive when promised. : ^ )
customer_reviews.author: Chris Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The remote itself works as advertised, when charged. The original charging cable only worked after one charge. I thought it must be a bad cable so I found another and initially it worked. Once again the batteries won't accept a charge unless I unplug and re-plug the cable several times. For the price, I cannot recommend this remote. Much better off with one that you can change the batteries in.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Remote is crap
customer_reviews.text: Software is very lacking in user customization. Remote did not work for me because I don't have a DVR box so I cant setup a "watch TV" activity. If I wanted to switch profiles on my remote just to change the sound or pause my movie, I would have settled with using 2 remotes and spending my money on something else. Very disappointed with my purchase, contacting the seller for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A Dream to Use, Though Setup Can Be a Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The hardware of this and the near-identical 650 is the sweet spot between Harmony's gratuitously overdesigned higher-end product and bargain-basement generic universal remotes. The most technophobe-friendly of the Harmony line, in my opinion, straddling the fence between power and ease-of-use. But holy mother of all that is holy, is Logitech's software awful. If you're not technically inclined, enlist one such to help you set it up, and hope you don't need to make changes. Once you learn to navigate the software, it's quite powerful and useful, but there's an incredibly learning curve, even for this techie. Once configured, though, it's just a great little remote, hence the high rating.
customer_reviews.author: JRR

customer_reviews.title: 5 remotes no more...I'm down to 1!
customer_reviews.text: I can't overstate how much I love this remote. Now I can control my Vizio Smart TV, Apple TV, Xbox One, Vizio sound bar, and cable box with ONE remote!!! I was a little worried that getting it to pair with my cable box (Scientific Atlanta something something) since it's not a new or well-known product, but it works great! Easy to program through the computer and I like being able to program activities. Programing it take a little time, but once you figure out all the "tricks" it's perfect. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick A.

customer_reviews.title: Never Touch Another Remote Again!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing technology here. My favorite part is when by chance something doesn't turn on right, there's a "help" button and the remote corrects whatever didn't turn on or off properly. After you spend about 20 minutes setting it up - entering Model Numbers, etc... you will never have to use your other remotes again. This thing literally has every button on every remote that you will own. One specific thing I will mention is the duplication of the ATT U-Verse Remote. The Harmony 700 copies exactly everything that the ATT DVR remote can do - so no worries there!
customer_reviews.author: larrybeo

customer_reviews.title: Lost its charm
customer_reviews.text: This remote was great when I first purchased it by now, less than a year later, it has lost its charm. I have had to reprogram it several times to get it to turn on the proper devices when I press the "Watch TV" button. To this day, it's a crap shoot - sometimes the tv and cable box go on, sometimes they don't. I also have reprogramed it a few times to get it to work with my Roku. I think I've pretty much just given up on that one. It really is not worth the money I paid for it and I probably would not purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Embardo

customer_reviews.title: Coolest labor saving remote uses saved website device profile
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these remotes and dropped it on a stone floor after 3 years and broke it. But here is the coolest thing. With these remotes you set them up on the company's website and store your profile. The first time you do it you need the A/V device model. However after I broke the first remote, I purchased a new one, logged on to the Logitech website, and uploaded my remote setting profile into the new remote since my equipment was the same. It took about 60 seconds and I was ready to go. Everything worked as before!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to replace worn out 650s.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two to replace the 650 models that had simply worn out with family use. The primary advantage as I can see for the Model 700 over the 650 is this one comes with rechargeable batteries. And, it is black instead of silver colored. Logitech has many other more sophisticated models but this technology works well for the family and didn't want to have to learn our way around new remote controllers.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Set up is not as easy as it could be.
customer_reviews.text: I logged into their website then followed the instruction to add all the components to remote some connect easily and others did not. I had to have a technician come in to get everything working correctly. I spend two hours trying to get everything working with no luck. If your not tech-savvy you might save a lot of time and aggregation if you have a technical person program it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Winthrop

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Four remotes put away and counting. As long as you use the software to set it up, it works great. There are only two small things. First it would be great if there was an option to control the volume of the tv throughout. Second, be prepared for the rechargeable batteries not to work. I just replaced them with store bought ones and it works great. Long time between charges
customer_reviews.author: buddysbuddy

customer_reviews.title: Logitech: quit limiting device numbers for no good reason and REWRITE YOUR SOFTWARE
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, has newer buttons I like and the on-screen interface is easy to use. *HOWEVER* Logitech seems to think it needs to force people to pay $100 more just to add a couple extra devices. Earlier versions could handle twice the devices at the same cost. Furthermore, the software interface (either version) stinks. Open the API up so people can write their own sync software. I love Logitech and have been buying their products for ages, but I am not a fan of their design choices as of late. If this is the way things are going to be from now on, this will probably be the last harmony remote I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mykalson

customer_reviews.title: Love Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 700 after we finally rubbed the channel numbers off the old Logitech 600. The price was good because Logitech had just discontinued the model for the newer (and much more expensive) so-called "home entertainment" models. A quick check on Logitech.com showed that the 700 would control the same devices as the $500 remotes - at significantly less cost. No learning curve - essentially the same as the 600 model. Be sure to check at logitech.com first to be sure your entertainment components are compatible with the remote you want.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for my Harmony 880
customer_reviews.text: I've used my trusty Harmony 880 for the past eight years or so, but it is getting difficult to find replacement batteries and the charging station was getting a bit flaky. So I bought the relatively new 700 model and I have to say that I am thrilled with it. The ergonomics are much better than the 880, and the batteries are standard, over the counter AA NiMh rechargeable. I was able to use the same software setup from my 880, and five minutes after connecting the remote to my computer, it was operational. Battery life is over one week on a single charge (with fairly heavy use, 4-5 hours a day).
customer_reviews.author: tommyr

customer_reviews.title: Simplifies life
customer_reviews.text: Logitech's website is quite easy to use for setting up the remote, and the remote is very user-friendly. We have used ours for several months with no problems. Our system includes a Yamaha tuner, AppleTV, Samsung TV, Comcast set-top box, Sony blu-ray, and Internet radio. Update: I have changed the stars from 5 to 3. After 1.5 years, the remote started switching the Yamaha to analog instead of HDMI at startup, sometimes it would not turn off all the equipment, and it would turn the sound off when switching components. The battery would never show a full charge. Updates at MyHarmony did no good. As a result, we recently upgraded to a more expensive Harmony Touch that works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: trlamb

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for about $100
customer_reviews.text: I got it about months ago and it's been very reliable. I've used all kinds of Harmony remotes in the past and I consider this one in the middle of the pack in terms of quality build. PROs: -I like the fact that you can manage 8 devices for just $100. -Rechargeable battery lasts long and comes with a nice USB cable. I don't like cradles. -Good line of sight strengh. CONs: -The buttons next to the screen are not well designed. Sometimes they get stuck because they are rubber. -The activities buttons, arguably some of the most important one, don't lit up when you lift the remote.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tavarez

customer_reviews.title: Great remote.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Logitech 915-000162 Harmony 700 Rechargeable for about 5 years. The buttons were starting to become a bit "iffy". Because it was a remote that I knew, re-purchased the remotes (one up, one down), jumped into the Harmony setup, re-synced (only thing I had to do), and all was working again. Great remote.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel A.

customer_reviews.title: ... believe I suffered through so many years with the horrible remotes my cable provider issued
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I suffered through so many years with the horrible remotes my cable provider issued. It took literally 10 minutes to get my Logitech completely configured. This includes the 2-3minutes of downloading the software to my laptop, creating an account, and entering my home audio-visual equipment. It worked flawlessly from the first time I used it. What was really a surprise is the responsiveness of the controls versus my old remote. I thought that it was normal to take a second or so for each key on the old one. The Logitech does not behave that way. It immediately responds. I am now going to purchase another for my other system. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: George E White

customer_reviews.title: I love this remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote. If you have more than one remote for your tv/movies/cable, get this and your life will improve. After you set it up, you have one remote, you need to hit one button, and you are all set to go for what activity you choose. Setting up the remote is easy too. If you are computer savvy, you can hook it up to your computer and input the device models and it sets it up for you. Rechargeable batteries though usb are also great in this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: charles brauneck

customer_reviews.title: This remote is pure garbage and extremely frustrating
customer_reviews.text: This remote is pure garbage and extremely frustrating. It hardly ever does what you want. Switching tv input is aggravating and takes 3-4 button presses. When you're on DVD you can't control volume without switching device back to tv. Then you have to switch back to dvd to control the dvd. I've yet to pick it up and have it "just work". It's always a minute of troubleshooting. It resets by itself and you have to plug it in to fix. I'm a young tech type also, so this isn't old man syndrome. It's just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris So

customer_reviews.title: Get the Harmony 650
customer_reviews.text: This product is identical to thebut it is rechargeable. The recharging is annoying - it has a very short cord you have to plug in the wall and it does not have a charging base like the more expensive harmony remotes. Get the 650 and use rechargeable batteries if you want - it will be a lot less of a pain than plugging this thing in. With that being said, the 650/700 Harmony remotes have exactly the macro functionality I want without having the gimmicks (like touchscreen) that drive the price up without adding any appreciable value.
customer_reviews.author: John Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Logitechs Best
customer_reviews.text: Despite it being an old model, this is probably Logitechs best remote. It doesn't fall into the trappings of modern devices having to have the gimics of touch screens and voice control. Both of which add little to the utility of the remote but drive cost. It's only real failing is the lack of RF control. However this is fine for the vast majority of users.
customer_reviews.author: THE Sean

customer_reviews.title: Finally took the plunge!
customer_reviews.text: It seemed strange paying for a remote when I already have so many! Like so many others, I just got sick and tired of having to fuss with six remotes. The hardest thing about setting this up for me was getting it out of the package! I followed the instructions and in short order it was ready to use. One sequence needed adjusting, but it walked me through it. I love that as soon as you pick it up, the backlighting turns on! I am very satisfied so far. I'm controlling a TV, cable box, Blu Ray, Bose So,o, Roku, and even. Y new Chromecast device!
customer_reviews.author: S. Scheide

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: we have the harmony 650 and lived it so when we decided to get another remote we knew we wanted a harmony. After much research we decided on the 700. We recieved timely but after charging we found that it would automatically start over and then when trying to use different buttons it would not respond. In addition it would not communicate in a timely fashion with any of our devices. After contacting seller it is difficult to get it returned too. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mamas Crew of 5

customer_reviews.title: Oh so good.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old model that was 10 years old. This new one is just as good. I like the battery recharge which is an easy plug in the bottom of the remote. My older one had a cradle to place the remote in to recharge which in the later years was difficult to get it placed just so to get the recharge started. I like the new one as I know I will not experience the same issue as with the old one. Loading all my devices took less than 30 seconds as I had all the info saved from the other model. It's a great remote at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: dickinflorida

customer_reviews.title: Failure to work.
customer_reviews.text: After charging the batteries I tried to sync it with my electronics. It started but at about 80% it stopped. Several more tries were unsuccessful. I have returned the item to amazon and am waiting for the replacement. I hope it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cromer

customer_reviews.title: Much too touch sensitive!
customer_reviews.text: It's very sensitive! When I press a number, it multiplies it and I have to try over and over again. Very disappointing! Also, it's charging opening is in the front top and you can't use it while charging it...not a very smart design. :(
customer_reviews.author: Angela T Derby

customer_reviews.title: Most fun I ever had with a remote
customer_reviews.text: Getting it setup was time consuming, even with the online database. I needed to customize the way it tells devices to turn on or off when you change tasks. Once that was all working to my liking it is really a refreshing experience to have a universal remote that just works. One word of advice... Program an unused button to power on and off your TV. This way, if the remote thinks your TV is off but is really on, you won't get out of sync.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Needs charging often though...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works as advertised. I especially like that it works with my Apple TV 4. Only thing it doesn't have is a Favorites button or a Back button to control the functions like the Uverse Remote. Oh, be sure to keep the charge cable handy because you will need to charge it every couple of days. I think I charge mine about twice per week at most.
customer_reviews.author: JBinTX

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Remote.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific remote. Had one for 5+ years and buttons started to fail. Got the 950 and hated it. Si bought another 700 and back to being happy.
customer_reviews.author: Testways

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this remote works really well. However it seems to have a problem with my Comcast DVR. When you select the one step button to say, watch TV, it generally doesn't turn the box on 95% of the time. The other issue is that the buttons seem to need a really firm press for actions to register on devices as a result I tend to use my provided Comcast remote to handle DVR commands and the guide. For example trying to enter manual channel changes with the keypad on the Harmony requires lightning reflexes before the cable box times out and you end up on channel 4 instead of 401.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff77

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility issues. I had to use another computer to ...
customer_reviews.text: Compatibility issues. I had to use another computer to program the remote because Logitech's software is not compatible with my up-to-date, high-end computer. The trouble of having to call support right after opening the box was discouraging. [Update] The remote no longer connects to ANY computer. I am a long time Logitech customer and this is the worst product I've seen with their name on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Beechey

customer_reviews.title: We had the original Logitech battery remote and I loved that the updated version is rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: We had the original Logitech battery remote and I loved that the updated version is rechargeable! The design is much improved with the buttons being larger and the device being more comfortable to hold in your hand. It is terrific, love everything about this little beauty but... it takes sooo long to recharge. It sits plugged in all night and it's still not charged. Eventually it does charge up and lasts quite awhile but it's kinda irritating if you for get to charge it before you go to bed because you know it won't be charged enough to use until the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zigler

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I paid a significant amount of money and I am very pleased with this device. The set up is completed online and it's very intuitive. It has rechargeable batteries powered by a USB cable. I have a number of excellent chargers, so I use one of those instead. This was specifically bought to ease my wife's frustration with remote units. She was reluctant at first, but has all but mastered the device. For me, it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Klenk

customer_reviews.title: Simple enough for my mom!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom (late 60's - technologically impaired haha) to give her, as she calls them, "dummy buttons" for TV, DVD, ROKU, etc.. so the remote would change settings on the tv, receiver, cable box roku etc, with just a simple button. ftera programming, it worked flawlessly.. my mom couldn't be happier of the simplicity of changing between different devices all running through a home theater A/V receiver setup. a tv setup would be even easier
customer_reviews.author: scruffymurph

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote, a must buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this remote. I had the 650 but so hated having to change the batteries. I love me some rechargeable devices. Not exactly sure if there was an issue with my 650 or the 700 is just that much better but I do not experience any lag in turning on or off devices as I did with the 650. I love this remote and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I miss my Harmony 550
customer_reviews.text: Quite honestly, it works as described. If you're looking for a comfortable to hold all-in-one programmable remote that isn't exorbitant this is a good choice. The top maroon buttons are not illuminated, which drives me crazy as their functionality is the most you'll use (i.e. "More Activities"). Aside from the non-illuminated buttons this controls 5 devices seamlessly for me, however I miss my old 550 this one replaces. The supplied rechargeable batteries get about 7-10 days of usage before needing a refill.
customer_reviews.author: RowingHatter

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these now!  They are the bomb.com
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these! They work really good and are easy to set up online....plug it into your computer and sync. Maybe I am abnormally bright (not to brag) when it comes to electronic but even my wife and kids can work them pretty well. If it doesn't do what you want it to do you press the HELP button and point it at the tv and follow the steps. I got rid of 4 remotes per room. I know a lot about them now so if you have questions, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: jazzyj

customer_reviews.title: Good remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote has a combination of the high end functionality and the regular remote functions. The charge last a decent period of time but it is a little clumbsy sitting on a coffee table because of the round back side. I use this remote with another Logitech of a lower model number and the odd thing is if I turn on the tv with one remote then the other remote will not function on any devices "strange". I do like the Logitech remotes and would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ... normally don't write reviews but this remote was so easy to set up and use that I wish i ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write reviews but this remote was so easy to set up and use that I wish i bought this earlier. I will be buying one more for my bedroom. Paired this remote up with our receiver, tv, set top box, dvr, and Lutron Pico switch. took 10 minutes to set it up on the computer creating a macro to click on button to turn on everything.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: My favorite programmable remote
customer_reviews.text: My favorite programmable remote. Easily programmable for every device I have. Only works as an IR remote though - does not work with bluetooth devices like Amazon Fire Stick. But as long as I have TVs, cable boxes and soundbars that use IR remotes, I will keep buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moyers

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 700
customer_reviews.text: This remote is powerful. I really liked the functions this remote has. The problem I have is it didn't have my Pioneer receiver in it's library and I had to learn in raw mode to get it to work with it. It is suppose to wake up when you move it but I have to shake it hard, tap it on something, or push buttons to wake it up. When I plug it in now to charge it the display says insert batteries instead of charging. I have had bad luck with purchases lately working correctly so I might just have a bad one. My friend has one and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: aburton

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely as advertised with Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: The setup for this was fairly simple and it works nicely. I like the fact that it will turn on several components to say coincide with your TV (speaker, TV on) so you don't have to turn them all on individually. It was a little disappointing that it can't control my Amazon fire tv stick but there are other higher models that can do that
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product !!!
customer_reviews.text: The best!!!!! This is my second one. Replaced it because family keeps dropping it on the floor. Great remote. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: BADLUK1

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote
customer_reviews.text: I bought my original one of these 8-9 years ago. It has lasted until now and the main issue is that some of the buttons just recently started sticking so we decided to replace it. While this was discontinued, I was happy to see I could get it on Amazon. Great way to consolidate all of your devices including streaming players. Battery life is excellent...we only need to charge it once every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and they work great. They actually have faster response time when pushing the buttoms over my Direct tv remote. These are super easy to program using your computer. It just doesn't get any easier. I only wish they were RF too. But if they were, they would be a lot more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dogula

customer_reviews.title: Great all around - some work to get it functioning
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy basic setup, flexible, works, simplifies the remotes. Cons: If it doesn't function properly through the easy setup... it can take time to get all the tweeks right so it works as intended. Overall, it's great. Battery life is excellent (I think we charge ours about every other month). While the time to tweek it and make it work properly can be a bit long, the fact you CAN tweek it - is a huge plus. I'd definitely look at another Harmony remote in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E

customer_reviews.title: bad product and worst customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: bought this product approx 6 months ago and it stopped working. been trying to work with logitech's customer service but basically they ghosted me. this is the second remote ive purchased from them and both failed miserably. don't buy this product. nor try to work with their customer service team. terrible terrible user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The volume button didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the volume down button not working, this thing seemed pretty great. I purchased it while it was on sale for $60 on Amazon. When I had issues, I contacted Logitech and after finding out I was given a bad unit, suggested that I return the item to Amazon. However, Amazon would not allow an exchange for the product and was now selling the same thing for $100. I took the refund and am back to using 4 remotes. I guess it didn't work out for me and Harmony. I'm told there are other fish in the sea.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas L. Rossman

customer_reviews.title: Times are a' changing
customer_reviews.text: The remote has a lot of buttons to press as the old style of previous remotes. It works fine but after using Harmony's touchscreen remote with only a third of the buttons I now find it cumbersome. My son needed a new remote for the flat sceen in his bedroom so I gave it to him. But now I need a touch pen as my fingers aren't slender.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Osedo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought a "real" universal remote long ago. One button to turn everything on and off. Fully programmable. Buttons similar to typical AV remotes so it is intuitive to use and controls a wide array of functions. I run my TV, blue-ray/DVD player, receiver, and Apple TV effortlessly now. Setup was online and quick. No need for those old remote control codes. Just look at your devices, take a picture or write down the model number, and set it up. Takes just a few minutes. Feels solid in my hand too.
customer_reviews.author: yourskeptic

customer_reviews.title: Nice universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Good universal remote. It works great to switch between TV, Roku, Chromecast, and the other devices my husband has hooked up. I feel like I get low battery warnings much more frequently than I should... about once a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! On top of just setting up the ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! On top of just setting up the baddest theatre room, I have also replaced the crappy old remote that came with Direct Tv! This remote works for all my electronics, easy to set up on my desktop, and best of all if one of the many electronics does not shut off correctly this remote does a self fix and corrects the issue. Can't say enough, this is a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: SAVED FROM REMOTE CONTROLL HELL
customer_reviews.text: WAS AS CLOSE TO ACTUAL PLUG AND PLAY AS ANY DEVICE I HAVE EVER OWNED. HAD GIVEN UP ON UNI-REMOTES BUT I THOUGHT I'D GIVE THIS ONE A TRY. TOOK ABOUT 30 MINS. TO PROGRAM ALL MY DEVICES(ONLY HAD TO DO THIS ONCE FOR EACH DEVICE, NO CODES).WITHIN THE NEXT 30 MINS., NOT ONLY DID I UNDERSTAND IT'S BASIC FUNTIONS, BUT, GASP, MY WIFE FIGURED IT OUT TO. AND WE HAVE BEEN OFF AND RNNING EVER SINCE. SYSTEM INVOLVED: HARMAN KARDOM 3490(WITH THE WORST REMOTE IN THE HISTORY OF REMOTES), XFINITY CABLE BOX, AUDIOENGINE A5+ , MAGNAVOX T.V., SONY DVD, AND A ROKU. ALL OF THESE REMOTES HAVE BEEN PLACED IN PROPER STORAGE-THE GARBAGE CAN.
customer_reviews.author: DEREK

customer_reviews.title: backlighting
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good in many ways, the best being ease of use in that you turn on all equipment with one press of a button. The programing of the remote is somewhat time consuming but satisfying because of the ease of changing or redoing the set up. However there is one flaw that should and must be fixed. The plastic sheet that covers the buttons is subject to wear and allowing the light to leak around the icons of the button. This happened to me after only two months. Other lit remotes that I have do not do this. This problem seems to degrade by time.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Remote
customer_reviews.text: Great remote, functions as it should. Great service by seller at a fair price
customer_reviews.author: Troy Moppin III

customer_reviews.title: Great for all your electronics
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Can hook up quite a few devices! Can customize the settings! Battery life is great and easy to charge!
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Harmony 700
customer_reviews.text: Works well and I like it. I have compared it to my Logitech Harmony Touch. I liked the color of the "Touch screen" a little better. It has a larger screen. I like the harder buttons a little better than rubber ones on the "700". That being said, the 700 seems so far to be more durable and functions well. I purchased this model to replace the two Harmony One's I had that fell about half a foot and broke the screens! Overall very satisfied with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: ekka

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't justify spending the money on the better versions, so I thought I'd give this one a try. I was pleasantly surprised. I love this remote. It has made my life of a 1,000 remotes much simpler. It's super easy to program and works flawlessly. Doesn't kill batteries very quickly. The rechargeable ones, that came with the remote, ended up being replaced with normal AA. I was sick of having to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend not purchasing a Harmony 700 controller regardless of Logitech ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit works intermittently, sometimes it turns on the devices sometimes not, even when there is a clear line of sight to the devices. I have two activities programmed, both use the same devices. Most times one activity will function correctly, while the other will not. Most times it's a guess as to which activity will function correctly. I contacted the Logitech customer support and after seven minutes of having my description of the problem being repeated back to me by the agent, I gave up and hung up. So much for customer service. I definitely recommend not purchasing a Harmony 700 controller regardless of Logitech claims that it will function correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Randy White

customer_reviews.title: Great remote at a great price
customer_reviews.text: It works great, has almost infinite programmability options, and the battery lasts much longer than advertised. I throw it on the charger every couple of weeks overnight just because, and I've never had it die on me. I also have the Harmony 650 non-rechargable, and it eats batteries for dinner! Get this one and save tons of money on AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: 1 remote now!
customer_reviews.text: Just realized I've had this remote since October 2012. It's worked up to my expectations! I was concerned because some reviews indicated the remote had failed within a short period of time for some users. Been working great for us. We don't sit on it, or toss it around. Hopefully that's what happened to the ones that failed. Been going great, controls a cable box, receiver, DVD player, WII and a TV. Very happy now!
customer_reviews.author: Ron H

customer_reviews.title: ... one year ago and initially I thought it was great, but after 10 months it was not rechargeable ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote one year ago and initially I thought it was great, but after 10 months it was not rechargeable anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Birgitta Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great for complicated/multi-component systems.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the remote. It replaced the 5 remotes on our coffee table. I like the way the buttons light up when you move/shake the remote. The initial programming took about 2 hours to fully setup and debug with how my theater was interconnected. Once it was working, my 8 year old could power up the theater and watch TV or play the WII without my help. The programming app is web based and supported everyone of my components (Projector, Receiver, Cable box, Blu-ray, Wii, and a old VCR).
customer_reviews.author: stealthpilot

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  No longer a fan!
customer_reviews.text: Original review: Easy to set up. Adjusts quickly if devices don't respond as expected. Great remote! Update, 1-year later. Will not hold a charge, and button response is weak. Won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not my best choice
customer_reviews.text: This unit was purchased to replace a Harmony 880 remote which was old and had expired with no IR output. I found the new 700 unit to be not as desireable as my older unit. The set up was fussy and the remote action not repeatable as regard to the operator holding the unit in different positions. The return of the 700 was easy with no problems and a fast refund. My subsequent purchase of a new 880 was as expected,fast and good shipping protection and the new unit worked just as well as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: david cowell

customer_reviews.title: Great Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product. It's build quality is very good and the on line and phone tech support is the best I've seen. I had a problem controlling a rather unusual DVR. The tech person took control through my computer and custom built a program that would work. Wow! Competent, polite and willing to do whatever it took. My complaints are minor. Some of the more frequently used buttons are too small for easy use by my man fingers. The remote must be pointed directly at the device to be controlled and I mean Right At it. I do highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: Set up is very easy with the new software
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the remote for about a month now. Set up is very easy with the new software. Once you add all of your device and try it out, you might have to change some of the button functions on the remote to match the correct device or to tweak it to your preferences. The remote doesn't charge while its plugged into the computer so remember to charge it before you use it. The is the probably the best universal remote for the price right now and I definitely recommend it if you want an inexpensive but well featured remote.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: A solid "good"
customer_reviews.text: Pro's - price - ease of setup and easy of use - Harmony style which I've become adjusted to Neg's - no battery meter -- c'mon guys.. this is a no brainer - no base to charge it -- also would have paid more for this, it should have been an option - occasionally it freezes after disconnected the power cord, you have to re-load the programming via the Harmony website to get it to unfreeze

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 year old that loves to watch movies and I also have in-laws that are tech challenged. Before buying this product we'd have them over to babysit the kiddo and we'd get calls like, "We can't get the thingy to work!!" This remote makes it really simple! It doesn't get much easier than "Press the button that says "Watch Movie." As a tech geek I loved how easy it was to set up. The really handy part is you don't have to jack with doing it from the remote you plug it into your PC via a USB cable and it makes the job a snap.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Lingerfelt

customer_reviews.title: Set-up is rather complicated
customer_reviews.text: And I still haven't managed to make the thing work properly. So far this "universal" remote turns my television set on and off, but I haven't managed to program other "activities." I was tempted to send it back, but have resolved to give it another try. Returning it would be a hassle I don't need. Besides, I'm stubborn. Logitech's help desk people--or at least the one I got--are not native speakers of English.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bienvenu

customer_reviews.title: Good Device and Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older version and more expensive version. I like the buttons much better than the touch screen of my older version. I had an issue with my account. Customer service was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: WWF

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, if you Cavan still get one.
customer_reviews.text: Great item, easily retires all of your other remotes. Easy to use, intuitive etc. I’am not super hi-tech, this was a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: 22207Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad, still trying to figure out the issue I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Not to bad, still trying to figure out the issue I'm having. I have three components I mainly use. HD TV, Cable Box and Surround Sound. It doesn't always turn off or on all there at the same time. There will be one of the three left on or not turned on. May need to redo the whole connection. But it sure beats using three separate remotes.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-Rob90

customer_reviews.title: Logitech 915-000162 Harmony 700 Rechargeable Remote with Color Screen
customer_reviews.text: I came across this offering on one of my Amazon Today's Deals and am so glad that I did. I will be the first to admit that I am technically challenged when it comes to operating multiple remotes and consequently, don't watch videos if my hubby isn't around to push all the right buttons (I know, it's sad). But this remote has made it so that even I can easily operate the TV, Stereo component and DVD player without feeling totally stupid. We both love it!
customer_reviews.author: Toni M Campana

customer_reviews.title: Harmony is slow to fix software problem
customer_reviews.text: This remote itself is great. But, the web based software that one uses to program the remote (myharmony.com) is failing to allow users to login. When logging in the user receives a server error. Hundreds of people have reported this problem to the harmony user forums, but harmony appears to be unresponsive to the problem. Furthermore, the software itself has not evolved for quite some time. There is a lot more that harmony could be doing to advance this product.
customer_reviews.author: Will

It replaces six other remotes and supports 5000+ brands and 225,000+ devices, so you can be confident it will work with what you own today, and the things you'll add in the future.
